headline.main: The Mets Welcome Mike Piazza Home and Give His Jersey a Spot in History
headline.print_headline: Mets Welcome Piazza Home and Give His Jersey a Spot in History

docs.snippet: Before Saturday’s game against the Rockies, the Mets honored the former catcher Mike Piazza, who was inducted into the Hall of Fame last week, with a jersey retirement ceremony....
docs.abstract: Colorado Rockies defeat New York Mets, 7-2; Mets honor former catcher Mike Piazza in pre-game ceremony to retire his No. 31 jersey.
docs.lead_paragraph: Before Saturday’s game against the Rockies, the Mets honored the former catcher Mike Piazza, who was inducted into the Hall of Fame last week, with a jersey retirement ceremony.

headline.main: Tunisia Ousts Prime Minister Habib Essid

docs.snippet: Parliament voted on Saturday to effectively disband the government of Prime Minister Habib Essid, who had been in office less than two years....
docs.abstract: Tunisian Parliament passes no-confidence vote against Prime Min Habib Essid after extraordinary late-night session; move essentially guts Essid's government.
docs.lead_paragraph: Parliament voted on Saturday to effectively disband the government of Prime Minister Habib Essid, who had been in office less than two years.

headline.main: Pope to Young on Poland Trip: Believe 'in a New Humanity'
headline.print_headline: Pope to Young on Poland Trip: Believe 'in a New Humanity'

docs.snippet: Pope Francis told young people who flocked by the hundreds of thousands to his words Sunday that they need to "believe in a new humanity" stronger than evil, and cautioned against concluding that one religion is more violent than others....
docs.lead_paragraph: Pope Francis told young people who flocked by the hundreds of thousands to his words Sunday that they need to "believe in a new humanity" stronger than evil, and cautioned against concluding that one religion is more violent than others.

headline.main: I.O.C. Panel to Determine Which Russian Athletes May Compete in Olympics
headline.print_headline: Panel to Pick Which Russians Go to Rio

docs.snippet: A panel of three international sports executives will rule on more than 250 Russian athletes cleared by their own federations....
docs.abstract: Three members of International Olympic Committee executive board, which decided against blanket ban from 2016 Olympics on Russia for state-sponsored doping scandal, have six days to decide which Russian athletes are allowed to compete in Rio.
docs.lead_paragraph: A panel of three international sports executives will rule on more than 250 Russian athletes cleared by their own federations.

headline.main: Philippines May Still Impose Ceasefire With Maoist-Led Rebels
headline.print_headline: Philippines May Still Impose Ceasefire With Maoist-Led Rebels

docs.snippet: The Philippines may still re-impose a ceasefire with Maoist-led guerrillas, a senior administration official said on Sunday, a day after it was withdrawn by President Rodrigo Duterte....
docs.lead_paragraph: The Philippines may still re-impose a ceasefire with Maoist-led guerrillas, a senior administration official said on Sunday, a day after it was withdrawn by President Rodrigo Duterte.

headline.main: Rights Group Says Ban Militias With Record of Abuses From Mosul Battle
headline.print_headline: Rights Group Says Ban Militias With Record of Abuses From Mosul Battle

docs.snippet: Iraqi military commanders should prevent militias with records of serious abuses from taking part in a planned offensive on the Islamic State-held city of Mosul, campaign group Human Rights Watch said on Sunday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Iraqi military commanders should prevent militias with records of serious abuses from taking part in a planned offensive on the Islamic State-held city of Mosul, campaign group Human Rights Watch said on Sunday.

headline.main: Belgian Decathlete Overcomes Cancer to Get to Rio Olympics
headline.print_headline: Belgian Decathlete Overcomes Cancer to Get to Rio Olympics

docs.snippet: At the lowest point, when chemotherapy had turned Thomas Van der Plaetsen bald and weak at 23, even his brother, coach and biggest fan, Michael, thought chances for a comeback were minuscule. Now, barely a year and a half later, he is heading to t...
docs.lead_paragraph: At the lowest point, when chemotherapy had turned Thomas Van der Plaetsen bald and weak at 23, even his brother, coach and biggest fan, Michael, thought chances for a comeback were minuscule. Now, barely a year and a half later, he is heading to the Rio Olympics as the European decathlon champion — and with a full head of hair.

headline.main: Usain Bolt Brings Light to a Sport in Peril
headline.print_headline: Usain Bolt Brings Light to a Sport in Peril

docs.snippet: Since he coasted to the 100-meter finish line in world-record time at the Bird's Nest eight years ago, Usain Bolt has been the smiling face of track and field. He has served as the anchorman of the Olympics — virtually the only reason any ca...
docs.lead_paragraph: Since he coasted to the 100-meter finish line in world-record time at the Bird's Nest eight years ago, Usain Bolt has been the smiling face of track and field. He has served as the anchorman of the Olympics — virtually the only reason any casual fan would pay attention to a sport that has orchestrated its own slow, sad, drug-infused downfall.

headline.main: Even With Alex Rodriguez in Lineup, Yankees’ Offense Struggles
headline.print_headline: Rodriguez’s Return Turns Out Not to Be the Shake-up the Yankees Needed

docs.snippet: Rodriguez, in the role of cleanup hitter, struck out in all four of his at-bats as the Yankees fell to the Tampa Bay Rays on the road....
docs.abstract: Tampa Bay Rays beat New York Yankees, 6-3.
docs.lead_paragraph: Rodriguez, in the role of cleanup hitter, struck out in all four of his at-bats as the Yankees fell to the Tampa Bay Rays on the road.
